meanings.definition: To delegate or assign authority or power to someone.
meanings.sent1: She legated the task of organizing the event to her assistant.
meanings.sent2: The manager legated the responsibility of training new employees to the senior staff.
meanings.sent3: He legated the decision-making power to his pet cat, causing chaos in the office.
meanings.sent4: The CEO legated the company's future direction to a magic eight ball.
meanings.sent5: The teacher legated the role of class monitor to the most responsible student.

meanings.definition: To bequeath or leave something in a will.
meanings.sent1: She legated her antique jewelry collection to her granddaughter.
meanings.sent2: The wealthy philanthropist legated a significant portion of his estate to charity.
meanings.sent3: He legated his favorite hat to his best friend, knowing it would be cherished.
meanings.sent4: The author legated his unpublished manuscripts to a literary foundation for preservation.
meanings.sent5: The old lady legated her secret cookie recipe to her neighbor before moving away.

meanings.definition: To send as a representative or ambassador.
meanings.sent1: The president legated the diplomat to negotiate peace talks with the neighboring country.
meanings.sent2: The tribe legated their chief to attend the council meeting on their behalf.
meanings.sent3: He legated his mischievous brother as the family representative at the school meeting.
meanings.sent4: The company legated their top salesperson to represent them at the international conference.
meanings.sent5: The captain legated the first mate to welcome the visiting dignitaries aboard the ship.
